Retailers use payment processors, like Coinbase, to accept crypto. Coinbase accepts zero confirmation payments.
Zero confirmations are risky with BTC because of RBF. Bitcoincash doesn’t have that. A node won’t forward a txn if it has already seen the txn spending an output.
#BitcoinCash transactions only take a few seconds.
Bitcoin Cash has 0-confirm TX, no RBF on BCH

It was the the IOU feature that originally drew me to Ripple. I really like the of a LETSystem and it’s the perfect platform. (For groups like mutual aid societies.)
If you were going to issue an ICO on Ripple, you get set the IOUs to make them follow the rules of the JOBS Act, for example. I think one of the rules is no trading until after 1 year of ownership.

Anybody can create IOUs on the Ripple network. Nobody has to accept them. The IOUs come with different tools & settings that the issuer can choose to implement (openly, no surprises). Freeze is one of them.

When Ripple first started they got a bug that messed up theirs servers. The hashed ledger headers were there but everything was a sloppy mess. Anyone else running a node at that time has this info (Wisepass). Ripple had the hashed ledger headers & voted not to start over.
